Question
========

In research on the difference in reaction times between autistic and nonautistic children, a test is conducted on two averages. The researcher wants that to minimize the chance of incorrectly rejecting of the null hypothesis of no difference as small as possible. In order to goal, she can

Answerlist
----------

* Set the probability of a Type I error as small as possible.
* Put the probability of a Type II error as small as possible.
* Put the probability of rejecting the null hypothesis if it is false as small as possible.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Set the probability of a Type I error as low as possible...: Correct
* Put the probability of a Type II error as small as possible...: Incorrect
* Put the probability of rejecting the null hypothesis if it is false as small as possible...: Incorrect
